intro: Trichodium montanum, commonly known as mountain trichodium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense, spherical heads, giving it a distinctive appearance. Trichodium montanum is often found in alpine environments and is adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions.
